Text: I love the LORD, for He has heard my voice, my appeal for mercy.
Context: The psalmist expresses profound love and gratitude to God for answering prayers.

Text: Because He has inclined His ear to me, I will call on Him as long as I live.
Context: Continued trust and dedication to God are expressed because of His attentive listening.

Text: The ropes of death entangled me, and the anguish of Sheol overcame me; I was confronted by trouble and sorrow.
Context: The psalmist describes a past crisis involving mortal danger and deep distress.

Text: Then I called on the name of the LORD: “O LORD, deliver my soul!”
Context: A desperate plea is made to God for deliverance from the brink of death.

Text: The LORD is gracious and righteous; our God is full of compassion.
Context: Reflection on God’s character as the basis for why He answers pleas for help.

Text: The LORD protects the simplehearted; when I was helpless, He saved me.
Context: The psalmist acknowledges God’s protection in times of vulnerability and helplessness.

Text: Return to your rest, O my soul, for the LORD has been good to you.
Context: An exhortation to self for calmness and rest, reflecting on God’s goodness and past deliverances.

Text: For You have delivered my soul from death, my eyes from tears, my feet from stumbling.
Context: Thanksgiving for God's deliverance from death and the prevention of other sorrows.

Text: I will walk before the LORD in the land of the living.
Context: A declaration of the psalmist's intent to live righteously before God in gratitude for being spared.

Text: I believed; therefore I have spoken: “I am greatly afflicted.”
Context: The psalmist acknowledges his suffering, implying trust in God even when declaring personal afflictions.

Text: I said in my haste, “All men are liars.”
Context: In a moment of rashness, a sweeping negative statement was made about humanity.

Text: What shall I render to the LORD for all His benefits toward me?
Context: A rhetorical question pondering how to repay God for His goodness and blessings.

Text: I will lift up the cup of salvation and call on the name of the LORD.
Context: A metaphorical expression of accepting God's deliverance and continuing to pray in thanksgiving.

Text: I will fulfill my vows to the LORD in the presence of all His people.
Context: A promise to follow through on personal commitments made to God, suggesting public acknowledgment or celebration.

Text: Precious in the sight of the LORD is the death of His saints.
Context: An expression of God's care and value for the lives and deaths of those devoted to Him.

Text: O LORD, truly I am Your servant; I am Your servant, the son of Your maidservant; You have released my bonds.
Context: A self-identification as God’s servant and an acknowledgment of being set free, possibly from the snares of death mentioned earlier.

Text: I will offer to You a sacrifice of thanksgiving and call on the name of the LORD.
Context: A commitment to express thankfulness through an act of worship.

Text: I will fulfill my vows to the LORD in the presence of all His people,
Context: The psalmist reiterates the intent to keep promises made to God publicly.

Text: in the courts of the LORD’s house, in your midst, O Jerusalem. Praise the LORD.
Context: The psalm concludes with an affirmation of praise and worship in the community of believers, centered in Jerusalem.
